shortdesc.ph: Configures the video stream mode for different quality layers on the sender side.
Sets the video stream mode configuration with different quality layers at the sender.

p.codeblock: virtual int setDualStreamMode(SIMULCAST_STREAM_MODE mode, const SimulcastStreamConfig& streamConfig) = 0;
public abstract int setDualStreamMode(Constants.SimulcastStreamMode mode, SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig);

section.p:
By default, the SDK enables the adaptive low-quality video stream mode (AUTO_SIMULCAST_STREAM) on the sender side, meaning the sender does not actively send the low-quality stream. The receiver with the broadcaster role can request the low-quality stream by calling , and the sender will automatically start sending it upon receiving the request.
If you want to change this behavior, call this method and set mode to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM (never send low-quality stream) or ENABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM (always send low-quality stream).
To restore the default behavior, call this method again and set mode to AUTO_SIMULCAST_STREAM. The difference from the setDualStreamMode method (with parameter SIMULCAST_STREAM_MODE mode) is that this method also supports configuring the low-quality stream, and the SDK sends the video stream according to the configuration in streamConfig.

By default, the SDK enables adaptive low-quality stream mode (AUTO_SIMULCAST_STREAM) at the sender, meaning the sender does not actively send the low-quality stream. Receivers with the host role can request the low-quality stream by calling setRemoteVideoStreamType, and the sender will automatically start sending it upon receiving the request.
If you want to change this behavior, call this method and set mode to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM (never send low-quality stream) or ENABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM (always send low-quality stream).
To restore the default behavior, call this method again and set mode to AUTO_SIMULCAST_STREAM.
section.note:
The differences between this method and enableDualStreamMode are as follows:
Calling this method with mode set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM is equivalent to calling enableDualStreamMode with enabled set to .
Calling this method with mode set to ENABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM is equivalent to calling enableDualStreamMode with enabled set to .
Both methods can be called before or after joining a channel. If both are called, the later call takes precedence.

Differences between this method and enableDualStreamMode:
Calling this method with mode set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM is equivalent to calling enableDualStreamMode with enabled set to .
Calling this method with mode set to ENABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM is equivalent to calling enableDualStreamMode with enabled set to .
Both methods can be called before or after joining a channel. If both are called, the one called later takes precedence.

plentry.pd: The video stream sending mode. See .
Configuration for the low-quality video stream. See . When mode is set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM, streamConfig has no effect.
The video stream mode to send. See .
Configuration of the low-quality stream. See . This parameter is invalid when mode is set to DISABLE_SIMULCAST_STREAM.
